personalInfo.name: Sreedevi Kalla
personalInfo.title: Health Data Science Graduate | Data Analyst | EHR Systems
personalInfo.tagline: Health Data Science Graduate | Data Analyst | EHR Systems
personalInfo.summary: Graduate student in Health Data Science with hands-on experience in healthcare informatics and public health analytics. Skilled in developing predictive models and visual dashboards to improve clinical decision-making. Experienced with EHR systems such as Epic and Meditech, and proficient in Python, SQL, and Tableau for data analysis and reporting. Seeking to leverage academic knowledge and project experience in a challenging Health Data Analyst or Healthcare Data Scientist role.

education.degree: Master of Science in Health Data Science

experience.title: Faxing Executive – Utilization Review
experience.description: Extracted and compiled clinical documentation from Epic and Meditech for utilization review packets supporting insurance authorizations.
responsibilities: Extracted and compiled clinical documentation from Epic and Meditech for utilization review packets supporting insurance authorizations
Submitted clinical data via RightFax, eFax, and payer portals (Availity, Navi Net); tracked responses and assisted in appeals
Collaborated with utilization review nurses and revenue cycle teams to ensure timely approvals and reduced claim denials
Tools: Epic, Meditech, RightFax, Concord Fax, Excel, Smartsheet

projects.title: Disease Prediction Using Symptoms
projects.description: Developed ML models (Logistic Regression, Random Forest) to predict 42 diseases using 132 symptoms with optimized performance through parallelization and feature selection.
features: Developed ML models (Logistic Regression, Random Forest) to predict 42 diseases using 132 symptoms
Optimized performance through Dask-based parallelization and Genetic Algorithm feature selection
Designed data visualizations for symptom-disease relationships to improve interpretability

projects.title: Drug Poisoning Mortality Prediction
projects.description: Built and compared classification models (KNN, SVM, Naïve Bayes, Random Forest) using U.S. county-level mortality data with visual dashboards for demographic analysis.
features: Built and compared classification models (KNN, SVM, Naïve Bayes, Random Forest) using U.S. county-level mortality data
Created visual dashboards to analyze demographic and regional disparities using Python visualization libraries

projects.title: Pediatric Respiratory Admission Forecasting
projects.description: Predicted RSV/Influenza visit outcomes (ED vs inpatient) using XGBoost and Random Forest with feature engineering and seasonal trend analysis.
features: Predicted RSV/Influenza visit outcomes (ED vs inpatient) using XGBoost and Random Forest
Performed feature engineering, seasonal trend analysis, and temporal data transformations to improve forecasting accuracy
Identified seasonal and temporal patterns, achieving 56.7% accuracy and supporting hospital resource planning
